bigraph.preprocessing package¶

Submodules¶

bigraph.preprocessing.get_adjacents module¶

bigraph.preprocessing.get_adjacents.get_hop_2_neighbours(graph, input_list: list, hop_n: int) → list¶

Find hop_n neighbours of each item in input_list

Parameters

  • graph -- NetworkX graph object

  • input_list -- Input list

  • hop_n -- Hop hop_n

Returns

hop_n hop neighbours of the input list's items

bigraph.preprocessing.import_files module¶

bigraph.preprocessing.import_files.check_input_files(edge_csv: str, label_id: str) → bool¶

Check if there is any input file.

Parameters

  • edge_csv -- Path to the edge-list csv file

  • label_id -- Path to the label-id-list csv file

Returns

True on finishing successfully

bigraph.preprocessing.import_files.generate_random_graph_edges(left_nodes_count: int, right_nodes_count: int) → bool¶

Generate a random graph and write it to a CSV file

Parameters

  • left_nodes_count -- Number of the left-side nodes

  • right_nodes_count -- Number of the right-side nodes

Returns

True on success

bigraph.preprocessing.import_files.generate_random_graph_labels(left_nodes_count: int, right_nodes_count: int) → bool¶

Generate Labels for randomly generated graph nodes by generate_random_graph_edges() function

Parameters

  • left_nodes_count -- Number of the left-side nodes

  • right_nodes_count -- Number of the right-side nodes

Returns

True on success

bigraph.preprocessing.import_files.import_files(edge_csv: str = './inputs/neighbour_matrix.csv', label_id: str = './inputs/id_labels.csv', sep: str = ',', *args, **kwargs) → dict¶

Import links and labels from csv files

Parameters

  • edge_csv -- A CSV file containing edge data on each line: 0,4,2 that are u,v,w which stand for node 1, node 2, weight respectively

  • label_id -- A CSV file containing labels for nodes: 10,node_name which are ID,label for each node

  • sep -- A separator that is the boundary for distinct entities

Returns

links and label dataframes

bigraph.preprocessing.make_graph.make_graph(dataframe: dict, left_bipartite: str = 'left_side', right_bipartite: str = 'right_side')¶

Make a graph based on the input dataframe

Parameters

  • left_bipartite -- Left part of the graph

  • right_bipartite -- Right part of the graph

  • dataframe -- Bipartite graph dataframe

Returns

Generated networkx graph
